text: BACKGROUND : The immediate early genes ( IE ) of human cytomegalovirus ( CMV ) can be expressed in monocytic cells and are known to regulate viral and cellular genes .
<extra_id_0> Interleukin-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) plays a central role in numerous inflammatory and immune processes .
<extra_id_0> Interleukin-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> levels are increased in lung transplant patients clinically diagnosed with CMV pneumonitis .
The regulation of <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is dependent on various stimuli that include lipopolysaccharide ( LPS ) , viruses , and other cytokines .
These studies examined the ability of CMV IE gene products to modulate <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> production .
